meanings.definition: A person who is in charge of a university or college
meanings.sent1: The rectors at the university oversee the academic programs.
meanings.sent2: The rectors make important decisions for the college.
meanings.sent3: The rectors decided to have a pizza party for the students.
meanings.sent4: The rectors are like the captains of a scholarly ship.
meanings.sent5: The rectors guide the educational journey of the students.

meanings.definition: The head of a parish church
meanings.sent1: The rectors of the church lead the congregation in worship.
meanings.sent2: The rectors deliver sermons every Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The rectors organized a bake sale to raise funds for the church.
meanings.sent4: The rectors' words are like a beacon of hope for the parishioners.
meanings.sent5: The rectors provide spiritual guidance to the church community.

meanings.definition: A person who is in charge of a religious institution
meanings.sent1: The rectors of the monastery oversee daily operations.
meanings.sent2: The rectors ensure the religious teachings are followed.
meanings.sent3: The rectors dressed up as clowns for the annual festival.
meanings.sent4: The rectors' influence in the institution is profound.
meanings.sent5: The rectors uphold the traditions of the religious institution.
